inputs.selection_motivation: The link to US unemployment claims is the least directly causal to GBP/USD movements and offers minimal incremental value compared to rate and inflation drivers.
inputs.motivation: The link to US unemployment claims is the least directly causal to GBP/USD movements and offers minimal incremental value compared to rate and inflation drivers.

prioritized_link.motivation: UK gilt yields are the core benchmark for UK interest rates and directly drive the GBP/USD exchange rate through the interest‑rate differential; linking them captures the primary rate‑driven component of GBP/USD movements.

llm_raw_response.motivation: The link to US unemployment claims is the least directly causal to GBP/USD movements and offers minimal incremental value compared to rate and inflation drivers.

removal_decision.motivation: The link to US unemployment claims is the least directly causal to GBP/USD movements and offers minimal incremental value compared to rate and inflation drivers.

source_node.query: ((GBPUSD OR GBP/USD OR GBPUSD* OR "GBP/USD" OR "GBPUSD" OR "GBP USD" OR "British Pound" OR "Pound Sterling" OR "Sterling" OR "GBP") AND (USD OR "US Dollar" OR "Dollar" OR "US$" OR "USD$")) AND (exchange rate OR currency OR forex OR FX OR "foreign exchange" OR "currency pair" OR "FX pair") AND (news OR analysis OR trend OR market OR volatility OR movement OR change OR shift OR impact OR report OR update OR outlook OR forecast) AND (inflation OR "interest rate" OR rates OR "central bank" OR "Bank of England" OR BoE OR "BoE policy" OR "BoE rates" OR "BoE decision" OR "BoE meeting" OR Fed OR ECB OR BoJ OR PBoC OR "monetary policy" OR "fiscal policy") AND (economic OR economy OR GDP OR growth OR recession OR recovery)
source_node.name: GBP/USD
